div.head: CHAP. XXI.
div.ab: The kings heart is in the hand of the Lord, as the riuers of water: hee turneth it whithersoeuer he will.
Euery way of a man is right in his owne eyes: but the Lord pondereth the hearts. Chap. 16. 2.
To doe iustice and iudgement, is more acceptable to the Lord, then sacrifice. 1. Sam.15. 22. isa.1.11. hose.6.6. mich. 6.7. chap. 15.8.
An high looke, and a proud heart, and the plowing of the wicked, is sinne. Chap.6. 17. , Hebr. hautines of eyes. , Or, the light of the wicked.
The thoughts of the diligent tend onely to plenteousnes: but of euery one that is hastie, onely to want.
The getting of treasures by a lying tongue, is a vanitie tossed to and fro of them that seeke death. Chap. 10. 2. and 13. 11.
The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to doe iudgement. Heb. saw them, or, dwell with them.
The way of man is froward and strange: but as for the pure; his worke is right.
It is better to dwell in a corner of the house top; then with a brawling woman in a wide house. Chap.25. 19. and 13. 3. and 27. 15. , Heb. a woman of contentions. , Heb. an house of societie.
The soule of the wicked desireth euill: his neighbour findeth no fauour in his eyes. Iam.4.5. , Heb. is not fauoured.
When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise: and when the wise is instructed, he receiueth knowledge. Chap.19. 25.
The righteous man wisely considereth the house of the wicked: but God ouerthroweth the wicked for their wickednesse.
Whoso stoppeth his eares at the cry of the poore, hee also shall cry himselfe, but shall not be heard. Mat.18. 30.
A gift in secret pacifieth anger; and a reward in the bosome, strong wrath. Cha.17. 8. and 18.16.
It is ioy to the iust to doe iudgement: but destruction shalbe to the workers of iniquitie.
The man that wandreth out of the way of vnderstanding, shall remaine in the congregation of the dead.
He that loueth pleasure, shall be a poore man: hee that loueth wine and oyle, shall not be rich. Or, sport.
The wicked shalbe a ransome for the righteous; and the transgressour for the vpright. Chap. 11. 18.
It is better to dwell in the wildernesse, then with a contentious and an angry woman. Verse 9. , Heb. in the land of the desert.
There is treasure to be desired, and oyle in the dwelling of the wise: but a foolish man spendeth it vp.
Hee that followeth after righteousnesse and mercy, findeth life, righteousnesse and honour.
A wise man scaleth the citie of the mightie, and casteth downe the strength of the confidence thereof. Eccles.9. 14.
Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue, keepeth his soule from troubles. Chap. 12. 13. and 18.21.
Proud and haughtie scorner, is his name, who dealeth in proud wrath. Heb. in the wrath of pride.
The desire of the slouthfull killeth him: for his hands refuse to labour. Cha.13.4
Hee coueteth greedily all the day long: but the righteous giueth and spareth not. Psal 112.9.
The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked minde? Cha. 15.8. isa 66.3. ier. 6.20. psal. 50.9. amos 5.22. , Heb. in wickednesse.
A false witnesse shall perish: but the man that heareth, speaketh constantly. Chap.19. 5,9. , Heb. a witnesse of lyes.
A wicked man hardeneth his face: but as for the vpright, he directeth his way. Or, considereth.
There is no wisedome, nor vnderstanding, nor counsell against the Lord. Ier. 9.23.
The horse is prepared against the day of battell: but safetie is of the Lord. Psal.33. 17. , Psal.3.9. , Or, victory.
